intro: Eriocaulon stoloniferum, commonly known as the stoloniferous ricegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Eriocaulaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its stolons allow it to spread vegetatively, forming dense mats that stabilize soil and provide habitat for various microorganisms. Eriocaulon stoloniferum plays a significant role in wetland ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity and ecological balance.
